messages.message:
Hi team, sharing some feedback received from the UOB trade finance team on a Converse solution they have been trying to build. They were trying to provide instructions on a long task as a document and have the MS model carry out the tasks using the attached case docs. (FYI As a next step I'm going to try and encode the "instructions" as a Build project that completes each step 1 by 1)
• Abrupt ending of the program (see screenshots)
• Results are not consistent for the same prompt and same documents attached. (sometimes the result was pretty good, other times not)
• Unable to get the OCR confidence percentage as part of the results. (in Converse)
• Format for the results - System is not following the expected format given in the instructions. Do you suggest any better representation? (I think this is overloading the prompt so will be why this is missed)
• Is the system capable of taking feedback on its own /auto training capabilities, based on the corrections/input back from the user for the previous cases? (sounds a bit like this: https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-3773 @BG)
I believe they have misunderstood a bit what Converse is useful for - but given we didn't provide them any help or primers this might be a common misconception by customers

i agree this may be more achievable in Build, not Converse

and as you already mentioned https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-3773, Build is currently not capable of taking feedback based on corrections from the user

cc @Kaustubh (KD) @margaret.tomaszczuk
Yeah looks like you are already trying to get this into Build but as you + Serena have mentioned the HITL feedback is not in any roadmap yet
